title: 111_hr3752
content: The Act may be cited as the "Law Enforcement Officers Safety Act Improvements Act of 2009" and includes amendments to law enforcement officer safety provisions of Title 18. The "Law Enforcement Officers Safety Act Improvements Act of 2009" amends Section 926B of title 18, United States Code, regarding the carrying of concealed firearms by qualified law enforcement officers. Amendments include clarifications on the definition of a firearm and exclusion of certain types of firearms. The "Law Enforcement Officers Safety Act Improvements Act of 2009" amends Section 926B of title 18, United States Code, to include definitions of firearms and exclusion of certain types of firearms. Additionally, it amends Section 926C to address the carrying of concealed firearms by qualified retired law enforcement officers. The "Law Enforcement Officers Safety Act Improvements Act of 2009" amends Section 926B of title 18, United States Code, to include definitions of firearms and exclusion of certain types of firearms. It also amends Section 926C to address the carrying of concealed firearms by qualified retired law enforcement officers, specifying criteria for eligibility such as years of service and honorable discharge. The curr_chunk states eligibility criteria for retired law enforcement officers to carry concealed firearms, including completion of probationary period, meeting firearms training standards, and not being disqualified for mental health reasons. The curr_chunk modifies eligibility criteria for retired law enforcement officers to carry concealed firearms, including changing "retired" to "separated" and updating training standards. The curr_chunk modifies eligibility criteria for retired law enforcement officers to carry concealed firearms by updating training standards and requiring a certification from the state or a certified firearms instructor indicating that the individual has met active duty standards. The curr_chunk updates firearms training standards for retired law enforcement officers carrying concealed firearms, requiring adherence to state or law enforcement agency standards for the type of firearm carried. The curr_chunk discusses the National Firearms Act, excluding machineguns, firearm silencers, and destructive devices. It also expands the definition of 'service with a public agency as a law enforcement officer' to include various law enforcement roles. The curr_chunk amends Section 922(q)(2)(B)(vi) to include qualified law enforcement officers and qualified retired law enforcement officers.
